name: John Smith
bio: With over 20 years of experience, Chef Somchai is a master at creating traditional Thai dishes. His passion for cooking and attention to detail have earned him a reputation as one of the best chefs in Thailand.

recipe_info.name: Green Curry
recipe_info.ingredients: 2 tbsp vegetable oil,2 garlic cloves, chopped,1 onion, chopped,1 green bell pepper, chopped,1 lb boneless chicken breast, sliced,3 tbsp green curry paste,1 can coconut milk,1 tbsp fish sauce,1 tbsp palm sugar
recipe_info.method:
1. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and onion, and cook until softened.
2. Add the green bell pepper and cook for a few minutes, until it begins to soften.
3. Add the chicken and cook until browned.
4. Add the green curry paste and cook for a minute or two, until fragrant.
5. Pour in the coconut milk and add the fish sauce and palm sugar. Stir well to combine.
6. Bring to a simmer and cook for about 20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
7. Squeeze in the lime juice and stir.
8. Serve hot with rice.

recipe_info.name: Pad See Ew
recipe_info.ingredients: 8 oz fresh wide rice noodles,2 tbsp vegetable oil,2 garlic cloves, chopped,1 egg, lightly beaten,8 oz beef sirloin, sliced,1 tbsp dark soy sauce,1 tbsp oyster sauce,1 tsp sugar,1/4 tsp black pepper,1 cup broccoli florets
recipe_info.method:
1. Soak the rice noodles in hot water for 5-10 minutes, until softened.
2. Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and cook for a few seconds, until fragrant.
3. Add the egg and scramble until cooked.
4. Add the beef and stir-fry for a few minutes, until browned.
5. Add the soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, and black pepper. Stir well to combine.
6. Add the broccoli and stir-fry for a few minutes, until tender.
7. Drain the noodles and add them to the wok. Toss everything together and cook for a minute or two, until heated through.
8. Serve hot.

recipe_info.name: Tom Yum Goong
recipe_info.ingredients: 2 cups water,2 lemongrass stalks, chopped,2 kaffir lime leaves,2 garlic cloves, chopped,1 inch piece of galangal, sliced,3-4 bird's eye chilies,1 tbsp fish sauce,1 tbsp lime juice,1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined,1/2 cup mushrooms, sliced
recipe_info.method:
1. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and onion, and cook until softened.
2. Add the green bell pepper and cook for a few minutes, until it begins to soften.
3. Add the chicken and cook until browned.
4. Add the green curry paste and cook for a minute or two, until fragrant.
5. Pour in the coconut milk and add the fish sauce and palm sugar. Stir well to combine.
6. Bring to a simmer and cook for about 20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
7. Squeeze in the lime juice and stir.
8. Serve hot with rice.

name: Emily Johnson
bio: Born and raised in Bangkok, Chef Pim has a deep understanding of Thai cuisine. Her recipes are inspired by the flavors of her childhood, and she puts her own modern twist on traditional dishes.

recipe_info.name: Tom Yum Goong
recipe_info.ingredients: 2 cups water,2 lemongrass stalks, chopped,2 kaffir lime leaves,2 garlic cloves, chopped,1 inch piece of galangal, sliced,3-4 bird's eye chilies,1 tbsp fish sauce,1 tbsp lime juice,1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined,1/2 cup mushrooms, sliced
recipe_info.method:
1. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and onion, and cook until softened.
2. Add the green bell pepper and cook for a few minutes, until it begins to soften.
3. Add the chicken and cook until browned.
4. Add the green curry paste and cook for a minute or two, until fragrant.
5. Pour in the coconut milk and add the fish sauce and palm sugar. Stir well to combine.
6. Bring to a simmer and cook for about 20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
7. Squeeze in the lime juice and stir.
8. Serve hot with rice.

recipe_info.name: Chicken Satay Skewers
recipe_info.ingredients: 500g chicken breast, cut into strips,1 tbsp curry powder,1 tbsp turmeric powder,2 garlic cloves, minced,1 tbsp brown sugar,1 tbsp soy sauce,1 tbsp fish sauce,1 tbsp vegetable oil,Bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
recipe_info.method:
1. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add green curry paste and stir-fry for 1 minute.
3. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned.
4. Add coconut milk, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Stir to combine.
5. Add bamboo shoots and simmer for 10-15 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
6. Serve hot with rice.

bio: Chef Nong's love for cooking began when she was just a child, helping her grandmother prepare meals in the kitchen. Today, she is known for her delicious street food and innovative use of ingredients.

name: Green Curry Chicken
bio: With over 15 years of experience in Thai cuisine, Chef Taweesak is an expert in creating bold, flavorful dishes. He is passionate about using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients and creating dishes that are both beautiful and delicious.

recipe_info.name: Green Curry Chicken
recipe_info.ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces,1 can (14 oz) coconut milk,2 tbsp green curry paste,1 tbsp fish sauce,1 tbsp brown sugar,1 cup bamboo shoots
recipe_info.method:
1. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add green curry paste and stir-fry for 1 minute.
3. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned.
4. Add coconut milk, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Stir to combine.
5. Add bamboo shoots and simmer for 10-15 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
6. Serve hot with rice.

recipe_info.name: Prawn Pad Thai
recipe_info.ingredients: 200g rice noodles,2 tbsp vegetable oil,200g raw peeled prawns,1 red pepper, sliced,3 garlic cloves, chopped,3 eggs, beaten,3 tbsp fish sauce,3 tbsp tamarind paste,2 tbsp sugar,1 tbsp chilli flakes,1 lime, cut into wedges,Handful of coriander leaves,Handful of chopped peanuts
recipe_info.method:
1. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add green curry paste and stir-fry for 1 minute.
3. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned.
4. Add coconut milk, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Stir to combine.
5. Add bamboo shoots and simmer for 10-15 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
6. Serve hot with rice.

name: Mark Davis
bio: Chef Ying's love for cooking began at a young age, watching her mother prepare meals for their family. Today, she is known for her inventive fusion dishes, blending traditional Thai flavors with international ingredients.

name: Karen Lee
bio: Chef Supinya, also known as Jay Fai, is famous for her crab omelettes and other seafood dishes. She has been cooking for over 40 years and is one of the most respected chefs in Thailand. Despite her fame, she remains humble and dedicated to her craft.
